issue.title: TYP: mixed arithmetic with float/complex scalars and int is incompatible with field operations

repository.name: numpy
repository.description: The fundamental package for scientific computing with Python.

issue.body:
### Describe the issue:

Apart from float64 and complex128 the annotations for `__mul__` etc with float complex types (float32 etc) are incompatible with the operations of a field if mixed multiplication, division and power with `int` are expected.

Type checkers complain about `__mul__`, `__truediv__` for floats and also `__rmul__`, `__pow__` for complex.

Probably there are similar issues for `__add__` etc as well.

### Reproduce the code example:

```python
from typing import Protocol, Self

import numpy as np

class FieldElement(Protocol):
    """Real elements supporting field operations."""

    def __pos__(self) -> Self: ...
    def __neg__(self) -> Self: ...
    def __add__(self, other: Self, /) -> Self: ...
    def __sub__(self, other: Self, /) -> Self: ...
    def __mul__(self, other: Self | int, /) -> Self: ...
    def __rmul__(self, other: int, /) -> Self: ...
    def __pow__(self, other: int, /) -> Self: ...
    def __truediv__(self, other: Self | int, /) -> Self: ...
    def __rtruediv__(self, other: int, /) -> Self: ...

a: FieldElement = np.float16(2) # typecheck error
b: FieldElement = np.float32(2) # typecheck error
c: FieldElement = np.float64(2) # ok
d: FieldElement = np.float128(2) # typecheck error
e: FieldElement = np.complex64(2) # typecheck error
f: FieldElement = np.complex128(2) # ok
g: FieldElement = np.complex256(2) # typecheck error

def func1(x: np.floating):
    func3(x) # typecheck error

def func2(x: np.complexfloating):
    func3(x) # typecheck error

def func3(x: FieldElement):
    pass
```

### Error message:

```shell
np.py:18: error: Incompatible types in assignment (expression has type "floating[_16Bit]", variable has type "FieldElement")  [assignment]
np.py:18: note: Following member(s) of "floating[_16Bit]" have conflicts:
np.py:18: note:     __mul__: expected "Callable[[floating[_16Bit] | int], floating[_16Bit]]", got "_FloatOp[_16Bit]"
np.py:18: note:     __truediv__: expected "Callable[[floating[_16Bit] | int], floating[_16Bit]]", got "_FloatOp[_16Bit]"
np.py:19: error: Incompatible types in assignment (expression has type "floating[_32Bit]", variable has type "FieldElement")  [assignment]
np.py:19: note: Following member(s) of "floating[_32Bit]" have conflicts:
np.py:19: note:     __mul__: expected "Callable[[floating[_32Bit] | int], floating[_32Bit]]", got "_FloatOp[_32Bit]"
np.py:19: note:     __truediv__: expected "Callable[[floating[_32Bit] | int], floating[_32Bit]]", got "_FloatOp[_32Bit]"

np.py:21: note:     __mul__: expected "Callable[[floating[_128Bit] | int], floating[_128Bit]]", got "_FloatOp[_128Bit]"
np.py:21: note:     __truediv__: expected "Callable[[floating[_128Bit] | int], floating[_128Bit]]", got "_FloatOp[_128Bit]"
np.py:22: error: Incompatible types in assignment (expression has type "complexfloating[_32Bit, _32Bit]", variable has type "FieldElement")  [assignment]
np.py:22: note: Following member(s) of "complexfloating[_32Bit, _32Bit]" have conflicts:
np.py:22: note:     Expected:
np.py:22: note:         def __mul__(self, complexfloating[_32Bit, _32Bit] | int, /) -> complexfloating[_32Bit, _32Bit]
np.py:22: note:     Got:
np.py:22: note:         @overload
np.py:22: note:         def __mul__(self, number[_32Bit, int | float | complex] | number[_16Bit, int | float | complex] | number[_8Bit, int | float | complex] | builtins.bool | numpy.bool[builtins.bool], /) -> complexfloating[_32Bit, _32Bit]
np.py:22: note:         @overload
np.py:22: note:         def __mul__(self, complex | float64 | complex128, /) -> complexfloating[_32Bit, _32Bit] | complex128

np.py:22: note:         def [_NBit: NBitBase] __pow__(self, number[_NBit, int | float | complex], /) -> complexfloating[_32Bit, _32Bit] | complexfloating[_NBit, _NBit]

Found 7 errors in 1 file (checked 1 source file)
```

### Python and NumPy Versions:

numpy 2.2.5

### Type-checker version and settings:

mypy and pyright, default settings.

### Additional typing packages.

_No response_

This can be a tracking issue.

See also https://github.com/numpy/numpy/issues/27957

issue.title: 1.16 Release Planning

labels.name: meta
labels.description: Issues tracking a broad area of work

issue.body:
I am planning to release 1.16 in the coming weeks.

If there are any PRs you would like to ensure are included, please mention here.

This issue will be updated once the release branch is cut.

issue.title: Release blocker: Mypy ignores NumType's `numpy-stubs`

milestone.title: v2.3.x.x
milestone.description: This will be the first official NumType release, and will target the then-latest v2.3.x NumPy version.

issue.body:
Unless all `.pyi` are deleted from the `numpy` installation directory, mypy will prioritize NumPy's bundled stubs over NumType's `numpy-stubs`, contradicting the [typing spec](https://typing.python.org/en/latest/spec/distributing.html#import-resolution-ordering).

So until python/mypy#18997 is fixed and included in a mypy release, we won't be able to release NumType (unless we drop mypy support, but I don't want that).

---

More info:

- https://github.com/python/mypy/issues/18997
- https://github.com/jorenham/mypy-pep561-numpy-issue
- https://typing.python.org/en/latest/spec/distributing.html#import-resolution-ordering

body:
I'm not familiar with the mypy codebase, but maybe it's related to the order of these conditions `mypy.modulefinder.FindModuleCache._find_module`?

https://github.com/python/mypy/blob/7b4f6311e29452cc8d4ddb78331d0047c8b17e93/mypy/modulefinder.py#L513-L523

issue.title: Prioritize `.pyi` from `-stubs` packages over bundled `.pyi`
issue.body:
<!-- If this pull request fixes an issue, add "Fixes #NNN" with the issue number. -->

This fixes the import resolution order for stubs from a `-stubs` package and stubs bundled with a `py.typed` package, and fixes #18997.

Besides the unit tests, the effectiveness of this fix is also demonstrated at https://github.com/jorenham/mypy-pep561-numpy-issue#mypy-jorenhamfix-18997-with-numtype

After investigating a bit more, it looks like mypy's incorrect prioritization of stubs was limited to `__init__.pyi`. I confirmed this by adding `reveal_type(np.dtypes.StringDType())` to the `main.pyi` in https://github.com/jorenham/mypy-pep561-numpy-issue. With `mypy==1.15.0` installed, it correctly showed `numpy.dtypes.StringDType` *without* NumType, and `numpy.dtypes.StringDType[Never]` *with* NumType installed. So both #18997 and this PR only apply to `__init__.pyi`.
